text.author: Daniela Karine Ramos, Bruna Anastacio
text.title: The Use of Cognitive Digital Games in School: Contributions to Attention
text.summary1: (human1) This study presents an experiment which demonstrates the efficacy of cognitive digital games for improving children's attention spans at school.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) This study demonstrates that daily use of cognitive digital games in a school setting over five weeks significantly improved sustained attention and learning engagement among elementary students compared to a control group.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) This study suggests that integrating cognitive digital games into classroom activities can significantly enhance students' sustained attention and cognitive skills, as evidenced by improved performance on attention tests and positive feedback from both students and teachers.
text.summary4: (Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) Researchers investigated the use of cognitive digital games in a school setting to improve attention span and cognitive functions, and found significant improvements in sustained attention in students who participated in the intervention.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) This study investigates the use of cognitive digital games in the classroom to improve students' attention and cognitive skills, finding significant improvements in sustained attention among participants compared to a control group.
